critique: This document is an executive order regarding the transfer of land between the Tennessee Valley Authority and the Department of Agriculture for inclusion in the Cherokee National Forest. It seems to be a routine administrative action with little to no ideological content. Therefore, most of the scores should be neutral. There's a slight tilt towards federalism as it involves a federal entity (TVA) transferring land to another federal entity (Department of Agriculture) for national forest purposes, indicating a consolidation of federal control over land management. There is no impact on immigration, executive power, national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, or social inclusion.
